meanings.definition: Put (someone or something) into a situation in which there is a danger of loss, harm, or failure.
meanings.sent1: By not studying for the test, I am jeopardising my chances of getting a good grade.
meanings.sent2: Speeding on the road is jeopardising the safety of everyone around.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting my umbrella on a rainy day is jeopardising my hairdo!
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs is like jeopardising your own well-being.
meanings.sent5: Leaving the door unlocked is jeopardising the security of the house.

meanings.sent1: Eating expired food can jeopardise your health.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a helmet while biking can jeopardise your safety.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once may jeopardise your success.
meanings.sent4: Skipping breakfast can jeopardise your energy levels for the day.
meanings.sent5: Leaving the campfire unattended can jeopardise the entire forest.
